document.heading: District of Columbia Newborn Screening Requirement Act of 1979

history.narrative: Law 3-65, the “District of Columbia Newborn Screening Requirement Act of 1979,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 3-126, which was referred to the Committee on Human Resources. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on January 22, 1980 and February 5, 1980, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on March 4, 1980, it was assigned Act No. 3-163 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
